meanings.definition: Tending to break into small fragments or crumbs.
meanings.sent1: The old cookie was crumblier than the fresh one.
meanings.sent2: The dry cake became crumblier as it sat out.
meanings.sent3: I tried to stack the crumblier crackers, but they kept falling apart.
meanings.sent4: The ancient parchment was so crumblier, it disintegrated at a touch.
meanings.sent5: The crumblier sandcastle collapsed with a gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: Becoming more easily broken into small pieces.
meanings.sent1: The stale bread was crumblier than the soft loaf.
meanings.sent2: The clay sculpture grew crumblier as it dried in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The crumblier cookies crumbled in my hands as I tried to dunk them in milk.
meanings.sent4: The crumblier leaves on the ground crackled under my feet.
meanings.sent5: The crumblier ice on the pond shattered with a single step.
